message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about named entity recognition (NER) in Chinese microblogs using a neural framework. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also uses embeddings and neural networks, which are common techniques in machine learning, so cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new approach for NER, which involves semantic information and multiple granularities, indicating that it could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also evaluates its approach on two datasets, suggesting that it could be relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
